title: Supplying Passworded Models
text: list models (stored character objects) included default MVPapp installed, shiny/code_templates.R, within directory MVPapp installed. list users sees drop-list select models, stored vector characters called model_examples_list. two functions related model selection: model_switch_conditions() pastes relevant model code code editor within App user selects matching model title drop-list. update_model_choices() stores model-specific information dosing regimens, MW, axis labels scaling (.e. Shiny Inputs) associated password. functions re-defined external R script, additional password-protected models become available MVP. example external file provided /shiny/passworded_models_example.R. user recommended copy script locally use starting point insert models, supply path pw_models_path argument run_mvp(), .e. run_mvp(pw_models_path = "path///private/models.R").

title: Supplying Passworded Models
text: structure model_switch_conditions() relatively straightforward - model provided key-value pair, left-hand side (LHS) title model, right-hand side (RHS) code pasted associated title selected. RHS consists object containing mrgsolve model code (character form, see Section “Supplying Model Code”), boiler plate postamble code (mcode_model_choice). postamble code required tell apart Model 1 / Model 2 model compilation. example (passworded_models_example.R), can see first one list called “Test Passworded Model”. title: Model Visualization Platform
text: MVPapp R package bundles Model Visualization Platform (MVP) Shiny application local use /deployment. MVP interactive pharmacometrics environment requiring minimal setup users, developed user-friendliness top priority even non-modelers may able explore different aspects models without much hassle, whilst balancing complexity advanced users. features include: - Live code editing using mrgsolve - Flexible dosing regimens, supporting 5 independent dosing schedules per model - Basic data exploration data cleaning, overlaying data - Quick NCA output reporting - Model comparison visualize differences - Parameter sensitivity analysis easily evaluate impact changing parameters - Automatic PK/PD metrics using user-defined time range - Variability assessment using external databases NHANES, , CDC virtual patients - Custom covariate distributions assess variability goal MVP support initial model development facilitate internal discussions efficiently.

title: Internal HTML Dependency for shinyBS — MVPshinyBSDep
Internal HTML Dependency for shinyBS — MVPshinyBSDep
text: list following elements: name Character string specifying name dependency ("shinyBS"). version Character string specifying version dependency ("0.61.1"). src list specifying source location dependency. Contains: href: Character string specifying relative path ("sbs"). meta NULL, indicating metadata provided. script Character string specifying JavaScript file ("shinyBS.js"). stylesheet Character string specifying CSS file ("shinyBS.css"). head NULL, indicating additional HTML provided <head> section. attachment NULL, indicating attachments provided. package NULL, indicating specific package associated. all_files Logical value (TRUE) indicating files included.

title: Internal HTML Dependency for shinyBS — MVPshinyBSDep
